workbook.name: A simple illustration of geofencing
workbook.description: This workbook illustrates a typical example of Kinetica can be used to setup a geofence

b45a2880-bf80-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.name: Block 1
b45a2880-bf80-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.content:
"CREATE OR REPLACE TABLE vehicle_locations
(
    x float,
    y float,
    TRACKID varchar(64),
    DEPOT_ID integer,
    sids integer,
    TIMESTAMP timestamp,
    shard_key(TRACKID)
)"

b45a2880-bf80-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.name: Block
b45a2880-bf80-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"CREATE THE SCHEMA FOR THE EXAMPLE","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Kinetica uses schema's to organize tables. It is good practice to have a schema defined for each project. Tables that are created without an explicit schema assignment are placed in the default schema ki_home."}]}]

b45a2880-bf80-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.name: Block
b45a2880-bf80-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"LOAD THE DATA","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"We will be using a stream of vehicle locations. The steps for loading this data are as follows."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"1. Define the table"}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"2. Set up the credentials for connecting to the kafka cluster (Optional)"}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"3. Define the data source"}]}]

b45a2880-bf80-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.name: Block
b45a2880-bf80-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.content:
"-- Credentials for the kafka cluster
CREATE OR REPLACE CREDENTIAL confluent_creds
TYPE = 'kafka'
WITH OPTIONS (
    'security.protocol' = 'SASL_SSL',
    'sasl.mechanism' = 'PLAIN',
    'sasl.username'='QZN62QB2RBTLW74L',
    'sasl.password'='iiJDdKeBzf5ms5EInLvpRslW1zwsTYx9tjZ1pQyVoS+gPGkyNms6eMXPaR6y+GST'
);"

b45a2880-bf80-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.name: Block
b45a2880-bf80-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.content:
"CREATE OR REPLACE DATA SOURCE vehicle_locations_source
LOCATION = 'kafka://pkc-ep9mm.us-east-2.aws.confluent.cloud:9092'
WITH OPTIONS (
    'kafka_topic_name' =  'vehicle_locations',
    credential = 'confluent_creds'
)"

b45a2880-bf80-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.name: Block
b45a2880-bf80-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.content:
"-- Start loading the data into the previously defined table
LOAD DATA INTO vehicle_locations
FROM FILE PATH ''
FORMAT JSON
WITH OPTIONS (
    DATA SOURCE = 'vehicle_locations_source',
    KAFKA_GROUP_ID = 'BH_90210',
    SUBSCRIBE = TRUE,
    TYPE_INFERENCE_MODE = 'speed',
    kafka_subscription_cancel_after = 120 -- cancels the stream after 120 minutes
)"

b46a5520-bf80-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.name: Block
b46a5520-bf80-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"ðŸ‘‡ NOTE","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The spatial analytics example workbook offers a more comprehensive look at Kinetica's spatial capabilities (including geofencing). Use that for a deeper dive."}]}]

b46a5520-bf80-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.name: Block
b46a5520-bf80-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"This workbook illustrates the concept of geofencing using Kinetica."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"WHAT IS GEOFENCING?","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Geofencing is the ability to classify an object as being inside a defined geographical boundary. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"bold":true,"text":"WHAT IS A COMMON USECASE FOR GEOFENCING?"}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The most common use case for geofencing is to trigger an event (for instance an alert) when an object is inside or outside the fence. Some examples include, "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"1. Triggering an alert when a vehicle enters a restricted zone, "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"2. Alerting a customer when a delivery truck carrying a package is within a certain distance from their home"}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"3. Sending alerts to a customer when they are close to certain locations they may be interested in visiting"}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"HOW DOES THIS EXAMPLE WORK?","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"This example illustrates the first use case described above. Our data input for this example is a stream via Kafka of vehicle locations (6 vehicles). We are interested in knowing when a particular vehicle (vehicle 5) is inside a certain zone of interest in downtown Washington DC. For illustration purposes, we will stream the alerts to a webhook but you can alternatively set these up to be registered via kafka or any other custom application like Slack (via webhooks)."}]}]

b46d8970-bf80-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.name: Block 1
b46d8970-bf80-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.content: "-- A temporary table to show the envelope on the map\nCREATE OR REPLACE TABLE envelope AS \nSELECT ST_MAKEENVELOPE(-77.05, 38.90, -77.0, 38.885) AS zone"

b46d8970-bf80-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.name: Block
b46d8970-bf80-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"VISUALIZE THE VEHICLE LOCATIONS","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Let's start by getting a sense for the location and movement of the vehicles. The speed of the vehicle is a bit accelerated for the demo for illustration purposes. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"We will be specifically looking at vehicle 5. So we will start by setting up a materialized view which refreshes every 5 seconds to record new locations that are streaming in. The map below show the vehicle moving through downtown area in DC."}]}]

b46d8970-bf80-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.name: Block
b46d8970-bf80-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.content:
"CREATE STREAM vehicle_inzone
ON TABLE geofence_alert
REFRESH ON CHANGE
WITH OPTIONS 
(
    DESTINATION = 'PASTE THE WEHOOK URL HERE'
)"

b46d8970-bf80-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.name: Block
b46d8970-bf80-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.content:
"-- Create a materialized view that refreshes every 5 seconds to register location of truck number 5
CREATE OR REPLACE MATERIALIZED VIEW vehicle_5
REFRESH EVERY 5 SECONDS AS
SELECT * 
FROM vehicle_locations
WHERE TRACKID = '5'
"

b46d8970-bf80-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.name: Block
b46d8970-bf80-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"CREATE A ZONE OF INTEREST","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"ST_MAKEENVELOPE() is a function from Kinetica's geospatial library of functions that can be used to create a spatial polygon. We will use it to create a polygon around the DC mall area. This will be our zone of interest."}]}]

b46d8970-bf80-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.name: Block
b46d8970-bf80-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"SETUP A STREAM OF ALERTS","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"A stream in Kinetica can be used to publish changes on a table to a target destination. This target could be a webhook or a Kafka topic. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"GO TO WEBHOOK.SITE TO TRY THIS EXAMPLE ON YOUR OWN","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The easiest way to test this code out is by using a webhook. You can generate one for free and observe requests coming in via the following website: https://webhook.site/."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Please visit "},{"text":"https://webhook.site/ ","bold":true},{"text":"to generate a webhook and paste it in the code below to create the stream. Once the stream is setup head back over to https://webhook.site/ to observe the requests coming in."}]}]

b46d8970-bf80-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.name: Block
b46d8970-bf80-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.content:
"CREATE OR REPLACE MATERIALIZED VIEW geofence_alert
REFRESH EVERY 5 SECONDS AS 
SELECT * 
FROM vehicle_5, envelope 
WHERE STXY_CONTAINS(zone, x, y) AND
TIMEBOUNDARYDIFF('MINUTE', TIMESTAMP, NOW()) < 5;"

b46d8970-bf80-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.name: Block
b46d8970-bf80-11ed-b6b9-bdf0f69f837d.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"CREATE A VIEW THAT RECORDS ALERTS","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The materialized view below records an occurence where a vehicles location coincides with the boundary of the zone of interest in the last 5 minutes."}]}]
